text: Abdullah el Baqui was a Member of the 1st National Assembly of Pakistan as a representative of East Pakistan. ==Career== Baqui left the Krishak Praja Party and joined the Muslim League in 1945. He was a Member of the Constituent Assembly of Pakistan. He is a leader of the Ahl-i Hadith movement in North Bengal. ==Death== Baqui died in 1952. ==References== Category:Pakistani MNAs 1947–1954 Category:1952 deaths
title: Abdullah el Baqui
